sect2.title: Object Initialization
sect2.para: To create a new object, use the new statement to instantiate a class:

informalexample.programlisting:
<?php
class foo
{
    function do_foo()
    {
        echo "Doing foo."; 
    }
}

$bar = new foo;
$bar->do_foo();
?>

sect2.simpara: For a full discussion, see the Classes and Objects chapter.

sect2.title: Converting to object
sect2.para: If an object is converted to an object, it is not modified. If a value of any other type is converted to an object, a new instance of the stdClass built-in class is created. If the value was &null;, the new instance will be empty. Arrays convert to an object with properties named by keys, and corresponding values. For any other value, a member variable named scalar will contain the value.
